title: Learning Katarina
body: Any tips for a player learning to get into Katarina?

replies.body:
throw your keyboard in a pot of hot water.

easy penta there.

Elbow drop keyboard.

At least a triple

Flip it on a frying pan.
Little harder to get the right flick of wrist, but you get a quadra AND you steal the dragon on top of it.
Start match, walk to lane, go make a coffee, come back to see you have 6 kills.

In the lategame, you need to be patient and look for good oppotunities before you go in. Wait til alot of enemy cc has already been used and you can get easy resets on low hp enemies. Biggest mistake I see people make is going in too early (especially when fed) and just dying.

Seriously now.
Keep track of enemy CC cooldowns before attempting an ult. Try to count as much as possible on your QWE and not R unless you know you can do it safely. Time your enemies, not yourself (if you're doing it right your cooldowns will be VERY relative anyways).
Also, try practicing Shunpo in - Shunpo out if you want to dive neatly.
And by the love of Noxus, stay away from Blitzcrank.
last hit champions and u will be k
Be bronze then play with bronzes (ez win). shes easily countered by cc so higher elos rape her

The funny thing here is, that as a general rule (i CBF checking it right now) that Kat's lowest win rates are in bronze and diamond+

Silver-Plat are her best win rates.
I always see kats failing (on my team) but only bcz they dont ult well not bcz of cc ;-; but yeah diamond bcz they know better (no flex zone)
